head.supplied: 9/11/83. ¶ To the Townclerk of Warrnambool. ¶ Sir. ¶ ¶ Knowing from former correspondence, that you are interested in the question of subdueing the drift-sands on your coast, I would like to learn fr...

div.p: Letters received, book 12, no. 2350, Borough Council records, Warrnambool, Victoria.

For a summary of the above letter see the Warrnambool standard, 22 November 1883, p. 2. M's letter was read at a meeting of the Warrnambool Borough Council on 20 November 1883. Councillor C. T. Stephens proposed, and Councillor W. Simpson seconded, that the letter be referred to the curator and ranger (Minute book 10, p. 118, Borough Council records, City of Warrnambool archives). 9/11/83.

Knowing from former correspondence, that you are interested in the question of subdueing the drift-sands on your coast, I would like to learn from you or perhaps the Shire-Secretary, whether the English Sterile Brome-grass, which seems there to have obtained the name Jack Hollis Grass, has proved efficient or even has been used to stay the moving of the coast-sands. In no part of Europe is the Bromus sterilis, though it is every where available, turned to account for this purpose.
